group_1.narration: There are so many things in my life@I'm truly thankful for.
Whenever my friends at school see that@I look tired, they worry for me.
Everyone is so kind…@I love spending time with them.@They're the reason I look forward@to going to school every day.
We have only one rule, and that is:@you have to say whatever is on your mind,@no matter what it is.
Don't hold it back!@Don't be so worried that people will hate@you for it that you hide it away!@Just spit it all out!
It does lead to fights sometimes...@but we always make up soon after, and our@relationships are all the stronger for it.@That's why we're not scared of butting heads.
To think that I'm blessed with such@good friends, that I get to have such@a great time at school...@It really does fill my heart with gratitude.
…And at home, my wonderful parents@are there to welcome me!
When I get back from school,@I'm always greeted by the delicious smell@of food as soon as I open the door.
My Mom's cooking is so good,@I can hardly stop myself from digging in@before dinner has even started...
But she can see right through me,@so I get scolded with a big "Hey!" if I try.
And Dad would look at our antics@with an amused smile.
He's a really busy man, but every day@he makes sure to come home early so@he can spend time with me.
He's a bit overprotective, you know?@But it makes me happy.
Everything I want is right here.
Of course, we're not particularly rich.@It's not like I can do absolutely anything I want.@There's a lot of things I don't have, you know?
But what I truly want is all around me,@telling me that I am needed.
That's why, from the bottom of my heart,@I'm really grateful to have been born here,@in Kamihama, in this world.@I really am…

group_1.textRight: You never do any housework!@All you do is steal my money!
We can't live like this!@Think of what you're doing to us!

group_1.textLeft: I've been busy at work!@That money went to business dinners!
You sure like to complain when you have no@idea what you're talking about, don't you?!

group_1.narration: My parents' angry screaming@echoed all around me...
I got rid of every hint of my presence,@hoping they wouldn't notice me.@It was as if I wasn't even there as I waited@quietly in a corner of my room,@simply letting time pass.
I was finally having fun in my dreams,@so why did I have to be dragged back@to this ugly reality?
As I closed my eyes and blocked my ears,@I rejected this world and sank into happiness...
It felt as if I was losing myself...@As if I was becoming invisible.
Or as if I was turning into a ghost...
Then, maybe "I" didn't even exist.
That feeling kept growing on its own.@It wasn't just when I was at home,@but even when I spent time with@my classmates.

group_1.textLeft: Yep, really! Like, if you ask me…

group_1.narration: I was a cheerful, energetic girl@from a totally normal family...@Or so I kept on pretending.
My father did whatever he pleased@and my mother suffered for it,@while our finances were so dire that@I didn't even have leftovers to eat.
But even as hunger gnawed at me,@I felt lucky that I could go to school...
Because if people learnt what I was really like,@they'd probably start avoiding me...
So I play the role of a fake me.
If I stay behind a wall of lies and@keep myself an enigma, they'll end up@believing that's the real me.

group_1.textRight: I get why so many people want to be@friends with you.

group_1.narration: I'm basically just constantly minding@people's mood, though.
I don't let a single truth slip out and@I don't say anything I really think.@I just reflect what they want from me@back at them, just like a mirror...
And so, every day I lose myself a bit more.
I often come here to kill time after school.
I try to spend as much time@out of my house as I can.@I'd hate to be there if my father@came home unexpectedly...

group_1.textLeft: But we were just talking about going to that@crépe shop that just opened...

group_1.textRight: Well, if you've got something to do,@then that's that. You sure are busy, Mikoto.

group_1.textCenter: If they knew I didn't actually have anything@I needed to do, they'd hate me...
I'm always turning them down,@no matter what they suggest...

group_1.narration: Not only does my father not contribute@to our finances but he also takes what@little money we have for himself,@so we're left with practically nothing.
So even if I get invited to hang out@after school, I have no choice but to refuse.
I'm superficially on good terms with everyone@for now, but if I keep turning them down@they might come to hate me.

group_1.textCenter: I... I don't want to be hated...

group_1.narration: Why is that?
"Because I want everyone to accept me."
